meanings.definition: Isotones: Atoms of different elements that have the same number of neutrons.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study isotones to understand how atoms behave.
meanings.sent2: The concept of isotones helps in classifying elements based on neutron count.
meanings.sent3: At the atomic party, the isotones all gathered around the neutron punch bowl.
meanings.sent4: In the nucleus neighborhood, isotones are like neighbors sharing the same number of neutrons.
meanings.sent5: Imagine isotones as twins with different outfits but the same accessories.

meanings.definition: Isotones: A group of atoms with the same number of neutrons in their nuclei.
meanings.sent1: The isotones in this sample exhibit similar nuclear properties.
meanings.sent2: Chemists use isotones to explore the stability of atomic structures.
meanings.sent3: The isotones formed a band called 'The Neutron Crew' for the science talent show.
meanings.sent4: In the atomic orchestra, isotones play harmoniously with their matching neutron tunes.
meanings.sent5: Visualize isotones as a synchronized dance group moving in perfect neutron unison.
